channel.title: 华尔街日报

item.title: "情况有好有坏。有些东西两天就能卖出去。而另一些东西则一放就是两年"。如何破解纽约令人困惑的高端房地产市场。
item.description:
“It’s a mixed bag. Some things sell in two days. Other things sit there for two years.” How to decode New York's contrary, confusing high-end property market. https://t.co/7E5VMSfKcz https://t.co/7E5VMSfKcz

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：@Judyshel写道：美联储政策制定者需要考虑这样一种可能性，即尽管有限制性利率，但通胀率一直在下降，而不是因为限制性利率。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Fed policymakers need to consider the possibility that inflation has been coming down in spite of restrictive interest rates, not because of them, writes @judyshel https://t.co/tmfDwKR4ow

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 超级名模吉赛尔-邦辰（Gisele Bündchen）几乎每天都坚持锻炼，并保持简单的饮食习惯。"她说："我的全部目标就是尽我所能活得最长，活得最好。
item.description:
Supermodel Gisele Bündchen exercises almost daily and keeps her diet simple. “My whole goal is to live the longest I can living the best life that I can,” she said. https://t.co/8N1oSAktXt https://t.co/8N1oSAktXt

item.title: 立法者解决了边境拨款问题上的障碍，为国会在紧迫的时间内审查和批准立法以避免政府部分停摆创造了条件

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：我们需要参议院中的亲以色列拥护者，他们将在最响亮、最愤怒的声音面前挺身而出。一些政客为了赢得选举，会说任何看起来受欢迎的话，做任何看起来受欢迎的事，但我不会加入他们的行列，@LarryHogan 州长写道。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: We need pro-Israel champions in the Senate who will stand up to the loudest, angriest voices. Some politicians will say and do whatever seems popular to win an election, but I won’t join them, writes @GovLarryHogan. https://t.co/aKC3jqdHTp

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: "如果你穿着袜子睡觉，你就是个神经病。"这一日益普遍的睡前建议引发了争议。

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普指责那些投票给民主党人的犹太裔美国人憎恨他们的宗教和以色列，这与他在担任总统时声称这些选民对他们的信仰不忠如出一辙。
item.description:
Donald Trump accused Jewish Americans who vote for Democrats of hating their religion and Israel, echoing a claim he made as president when he said that such voters were disloyal to their faith https://t.co/XGCItwj0UY https://t.co/XGCItwj0UY

item.title: 来自@WSJopinion：里根绝不会投票给特朗普，但他也不太喜欢拜登。约翰-雷曼（John Lehman）写道，和我一样，他也在寻找一位强有力的第三方候选人来支持。
item.description:
From @WSJopinion: Reagan would never vote for Trump, but he also didn’t care much for Biden. Like me, he’d be looking for a strong third-party candidate to support, writes John Lehman. https://t.co/EQhcOYxuQH

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：伟哥能预防或逆转阿尔茨海默病吗？人工智能让科学家们发现了旧药的新用途，Allysia Finley 写道

item.title: Todd Snyder 发现，男士们需要适合工作的服装，但他们也会偶尔放纵一下。这一理念推动他的品牌走向成功。
item.description:
Todd Snyder saw that men wanted palatable, work-appropriate clothes, but they also indulge on occasion. That thesis has propelled his brand to success. https://t.co/7e4qS2GyR6 https://t.co/7e4qS2GyR6

item.title: 来自 @WSJopinion：对美国人来说，海地常年的、看似难以克服的饥饿游戏是一个巨大的诱惑。但放弃并不是一种选择，@MaryAnastasiaOG 写道。
item.description:

item.title: 远离东京和京都的旅游人群，日本的一条多日徒步旅行线路让游客沉浸在 2011 年遭受毁灭性海啸袭击的社区的文化和美食之中
item.description:

item.title: "Z世代美国人从大流行病中走出来，对未来的悲观情绪超过了之前任何一代人。他们对两党的决策者都感到厌烦。
item.description:
“We’re just kind of over it.”

Gen Z Americans emerged from the pandemic feeling more pessimistic about the future than any living generation before it. And they’re fed up with policymakers from both parties. https://t.co/fQ3FcL2Gdg https://t.co/fQ3FcL2Gdg

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 19, 2024

item.title: "我太年轻了，不适合变老"。人们不遗余力地减少或阻止白发苍苍的过程。一些研究衰老问题的科学家认为，他们可能有所发现。
item.description:
“I’m too young to be old.” People are going to great lengths to reduce or halt the graying process. Some scientists of aging think they might be onto something. https://t.co/wGSw4zRbCO https://t.co/wGSw4zRbCO

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 17 年后，长滩州立大学和教练丹-蒙森（Dan Monson）同意分道扬镳。然后，他同意继续执教，并率领他的球队不出意外地进入了 NCAA 锦标赛。
item.description:
After 17 years, Long Beach State and coach Dan Monson agreed to part ways. Then he agreed to finish out the campaign—and led his team to an improbable NCAA tournament bid. https://t.co/gnJQhPGSSL https://t.co/gnJQhPGSSL
